msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This manuscript is a fifteenth-century Italian manuscript containing a collection of texts.

msItem.title: Excerpta orationum Demosthenis et Aeschini (Excerpts of the Orations of Demosthenes and Aeschines); Historia Romana (History of Rome)
msItem.author: Eutropius, active 4th century
Bruni, Leonardo, 1369-1444
Basil, Saint, Bishop of Caesarea, approximately 329-379

msItem.title: Eutropius, Historia Romana (History of Rome)
msItem.incipit: Primus in Italia ut quibusdam placet regnavit Janusâ€¦

msItem.title: Excerpta orationum Demosthenis et Aeschini (Excerpts of the orations of Demosthenes and Aeschines)
Leonardus Brunus Aretinus, Epistola ad dominam Battistam de Malatestis (Letter to Battista de Malatesta)
Basil of Caesarea, De legendis libris gentilium, translated by Leonardus Arentinus

supportDesc.extent: i+54+ii; 240 x 165 mm bound to 245 x 170 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, lower right recto

p.catchwords: Catchwords throughout on the lower right, on 8v, 16v, 24v, 32v, 40v, 48v

layoutDesc.layout: One column of thirty-two lines; very lightly lined and frame-ruled; written area: 173 x 110 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Five ornamental initials in gold and colors with marginal tracery; the coat-of-arms of the original owner in red and gold at the foot of the first page; capitals in red and blue; paragraph marks in red
1rIlluminated initial P and coat of arms

binding.p: Old calf with gilt floral stamps at the corners and in the centers of the sides, in cloth case

history.provenance: Unidentified arms of the original owner on the first page (barry of six gules and or); Thomas F. Richardson, Boston, his sale, June 11, 1919; to John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936.
